title: How to detect a jammer - Quora

response.answer_text: 200918–1753 A jamming signal is detected just like any signal. You must have a receiver. Usually a jamming signal is “extra strong” in order to over come the signal being jammed. Usally the jamming signal is quite obvious in its nature to anyone who is familar with the signals common to that band. Usually a jamming signal is highly variable to provide difficulty in understanding its content. A famous amateur radio band “jamming signal” often called the”wood pecker” turned out to be a high powered radio signal by the Russians to influnce weather patterns. X < > Y, Sonoran desert Richard
